Nadiem Buat Aplikasi Pendidikan, Anggota DPR: Timbang Dampaknya
04 Nov 2019, 09:09 by Antara, Yudono Yanuar
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Anggota Komisi X DPR Ledia Hanifa Amaliah meminta Menteri Pendidikan dan Kebudayaan Nadiem Makarim mempertimbangkan dampak ikutan yang mungkin muncul bila ingin mengembangkan dan menerapkan aplikasi sistem pendidikan.
Sebelumnya, Nadiem meminta waktu 100 hari untuk membuat perubahan sistem belajar berbasis aplikasi.
"Penerapan aplikasi sistem pendidikan pasti memerlukan perangkat, internet, dan pasokan listrik yang stabil," kata Ledia melalui siaran pers yang diterima di Jakarta, Senin, 4 November 2019.
Politisi Partai Keadilan Sejahtera (PKS) itu mengatakan Kementerian Pendidikan dan Kebudayaan tidak bisa berjalan sendiri untuk mengembangkan aplikasi sistem pendidikan.
"Banyak hal harus diperhitungkan secara luas dan integratif. Angka-angka biaya yang timbul juga harus diperhitungkan secara seksama, apakah akan memudahkan atau menyulitkan masyarakat di kemudian hari," tuturnya.
Ledia meminta Nadiem mempertimbangkan anggaran perangkat yang harus disediakan masyarakat serta ketersediaan dan kualitas layanan internet dan listrik pada setiap wilayah.
Tarif dasar listrik yang semakin tinggi juga harus dipertimbangkan dalam memperhitungkan biaya internet dan listrik yang harus ditanggung masyarakat untuk mengakses aplikasi sistem pendidikan.
"Itu semua memerlukan pertimbangan sangat seksama dari Kementerian Pendidikan dan Kebudayaan, termasuk dengan melakukan koordinasi lintas sektoral. Jangan sampai kelak justru menambah beban siswa, orang tua, dan sekolah," katanya.
Namun, Ledia menilai wacana pengembangan aplikasi sistem pendidikan sebagai suatu hal yang positif. Menurut Ledia, semangat penerapan teknologi dalam sistem pendidikan adalah satu langkah positip di era digital.
"Kehadiran aplikasi sistem pendidikan tentunya bisa menopang perkembangan sistem pendidikan kita menjadi lebih baik," ujarnya.

Nadiem Creates Educational Applications, Members of DPR: Weigh the Impact
Nov 04 2019, 09:09 by Antara, Yudono Yanuar
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - DPR's Commission X member Ledia Hanifa Amaliah has asked Minister of Education and Culture Nadiem Makarim to consider the follow-up impacts that might arise if they want to develop and implement education system applications.
Previously, Nadiem requested 100 days to make changes to the application-based learning system.
"The application of the education system application definitely requires a stable device, internet and electricity supply," Ledia said through a press release received in Jakarta, Monday, November 4, 2019.
The politician from the Prosperous Justice Party (PKS) said the Ministry of Education and Culture could not walk alone to develop the education system application.
"Many things must be taken into account in a broad and integrative way. The cost figures that arise must also be calculated carefully, whether it will make it easier or difficult for the community in the future," he said.
Ledia asked Nadiem to consider the budget of the equipment that the community must provide and the availability and quality of internet and electricity services in each region.
Increasingly basic electricity tariffs must also be considered in calculating the cost of the internet and electricity that must be borne by the public to access education system applications.
"It all requires very careful consideration from the Ministry of Education and Culture, including by conducting cross-sectoral coordination. Do not let it actually add to the burden of students, parents, and schools," he said.
However, Ledia considered the discourse of the development of educational system applications as a positive thing. According to Ledia, the spirit of the application of technology in the education system is a positive step in the digital age.
"The presence of an educational system application can certainly sustain the development of our education system for the better," he said.
